### Conflicts

Addressed feedback by @laanwj
```suggestion\nFinally, review and testing are important as well. It gives you an idea of what\n```
consider frequent for common to clarify
```suggestion\n<!-- A good first issue is an uncontroversial issue, that has a relatively unique and obvious solution -->\n```
```suggestion\nvarying difficulty waiting to be fixed. However, before you start contributing,\n```

```suggestion\nYou do not need to request permission to start working on an issue. However, you are encouraged to leave a comment if you are planning to work on it. This will help other contributors monitor which issues are actively being addressed and is also an effective way to request assistance if and when you need it.\n```
```suggestion\nreferences to any discussions (for example, other tickets or mailing list\n```
Committing
suggest s/a lot/many/

It may be a good idea to work in a phrase, similar to this one, early in this section: 

Reviewing and testing is the most effective way you can contribute as a new contributor, and also will teach you much more about the code and process than opening PRs.

(credit to @jnewbery for that sentence: https://bitcoincore.reviews/16512#l-139)
s/many of/many/
s/and/and it/
s/Comment/Comments/ or Feedback (in singular form)
s/developers/contributors/?
`[Peer Review](#peer-review)` (the section title markdown is `### Peer Review`)
`good first issue`s isn't very readable; suggest plain text here on line 47: good first issues (while leaving line 44 as it is)
maybe `P2P protoocol`? (to distinguish it from internal or interprocess interfaces)
I'm ~0 on removing this. You might want to replace it with a reference to the CONTRIBUTING.md.
There should already be a link to CONTRIB.md
